alert.note: Alert for Lake (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 10:43AM EST until February 20 at 8:20AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST/1 PM EST/ TODAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by a combination of rain, snowmelt, and river ice is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, in Illinois, Ford, Grundy, Iroquois, Kankakee, Livingston and Will. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper, Lake IN, Newton and Porter. * WHEN...Until noon CST /100 PM EST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Elevated ditches, streams, and rivers near bankfull. A few locations along larger rivers are expected to exceed flood stage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 937 AM CST /1037 AM EST/, numerous river gauges indicated bankfull to near flood stage conditions. Widespread rainfall up to one inch on top of frozen ground has caused minor flooding in many areas. - No additional rainfall is expected, but water may be slow to drain toward ditches and creeks. - Some locations that may continue to experience minor flooding include... Hammond, Gary, Portage, Merrillville, Valparaiso, East Chicago, Schererville, Hobart, Kankakee, Crown Point, Highland, Munster, Bourbonnais, Bradley, Chesterton, Cedar Lake, Lowell, Manteno, Rensselaer and Watseka.
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
